histogram.name: UKM.AppVersionDifferentWhenPurging
histogram.summary: Logged when doing a partial purges of unsent UKM logs. If the unsent log has a different app version that the client's current version then a true is logged and the report's log_written_by_app_version should be set with the current version. Otherwise a false is logged.

histogram.name: UKM.BuildAndStoreLogIsEmpty
histogram.summary: Emitted when UKM Service attempts to build and store a log. Emits true if it was empty (no sources or entries) which means no log is written, false otherwise.

histogram.name: UKM.ConsentObserver.AppSyncConsentChanged
histogram.summary: Logged in UpdateUkmAllowedForAllProfiles from the UkmConsentStateObserver. This records if App-sync was changed everytime a profile is updated. True will be recorded when App-sync changes and false otherwise. This is to understand how often App-sync is changed.

histogram.name: UKM.ConsentObserver.Purge
histogram.summary: Logged in the UpdateProfileState call from the UkmConsentStateObserver. This records if the UKM allowed change will trigger a purge of the local UKM data.

histogram.name: UKM.Entries.Dropped
histogram.summary: Number of UKM entries that are dropped. Categorized by the cause of it being dropped.

histogram.name: UKM.Entries.Dropped.ByEntryHash
histogram.summary: The hashed name of the UKM entry being dropped. The hash is the same hash sent in the UKM log but truncated to 31 bits with "event_hash & 0x7fffffff". Recorded when adding an entry and the UKM recorder decides it should be dropped.

histogram.name: UKM.Entries.Dropped.MaxHit.ByEntryHash
histogram.summary: The hashed name of the UKM entry being dropped. The hash is the same hash sent in the UKM log but truncated to 31 bits with "event_hash & 0x7fffffff". Recorded when adding an entry and the UKM recorder decides it should be dropped due to reaching the max number of sources allowed in memory.

histogram.name: UKM.Entries.Dropped.RejectedByFilter.ByEntryHash
histogram.summary: The hashed name of the UKM entry being dropped. The hash is the same hash sent in the UKM log but truncated to 31 bits with "event_hash & 0x7fffffff". Recorded when adding an entry and the UKM recorder decides it should be dropped due to the UkmRecorderImpl::ApplyEntryFilter check.

histogram.name: UKM.Entries.Dropped.SampledOut.ByEntryHash
histogram.summary: The hashed name of the UKM entry being dropped. The hash is the same hash sent in the UKM log but truncated to 31 bits with "event_hash & 0x7fffffff". Recorded when adding an entry and the UKM recorder decides it should be dropped due to it being sampled out.

histogram.name: UKM.Entries.Recorded.ByEntryHash
histogram.summary: The hashed name of the UKM entry being recorded. The hash is the same hash sent in the UKM log but truncated to 31 bits with "event_hash & 0x7fffffff". Recorded when an entry is added and accepted by the UKM recorder.

histogram.name: UKM.Entries.SerializedCount2
histogram.summary: Number of serialized UKM entries when storing a UKM log.

histogram.name: UKM.Entries.SerializedCountFCP
histogram.summary: Number of serialized UKM entries that are of type PageLoad that have the metric PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstContentfulPaint. This is recorded every time a UKM log is stored.

histogram.name: UKM.InitSequence
histogram.summary: Logged during UkmService initialization whether the init task or the initial log timer completed first. The expectation is the vast majority of the time, the init task should complete first. If metrics show otherwise, then it may indicate there's a bug in the UkmService init sequence and that it should be investigated.

histogram.name: UKM.IOSLog.OnSuccess
histogram.summary: Number of times when UKM.LogSize.OnSuccess was recorded on iOS. Recorded when the app transitions to the foreground. This histogram should help to figure out the root cause of crbug.com/1154678 (Data loss on UMA in iOS). If total count of UKM.IOSLog.OnSuccess is greater than number of UKM.LogSize.OnSuccess records, then data loss is caused by failure to write the histogram to the disk on background thread. Otherwise (if total sum of UKM.IOSLog.OnSuccess is equal to total count of UKM.LogSize.OnSuccess records) then there is actually no data loss and app simply gets terminated in a short window between UKM reached the server and the API call which records the data.

histogram.name: UKM.LogSize.OnSuccess
histogram.summary:
Size in kilobytes (after compression) of an uploaded UKM log. Recorded after a successful UKM upload.
Note: A related metric (UKM.ProtoCompressionRatio) logs the compression ratio.

histogram.name: UKM.LogUpload.Canceled.CellularConstraint
histogram.summary: Logs whether a log was not uploaded due to cellular log throttling logic. Android only.

histogram.name: UKM.LogUpload.ResponseOrErrorCode
histogram.summary: HTTP response codes and network errors encountered by UKM when attempting to upload logs to the server.

histogram.name: UKM.PersistentLogRecall.Status
histogram.summary: The status when loading UKM PersistedLogs from Prefs.

histogram.name: UKM.ProtoCompressionRatio
histogram.summary: Compression ratio of the serialized protobuf that will be uploaded to the UKM server. This serialized protobuf is compressed using gzip. See also UKM.LogSize.OnSuccess.

histogram.name: UKM.ReportSize.NonUkmPercentage
histogram.summary: Percentage that data non-directly attributed (e.g. system profile info, etc) to UKM take up in a serialized ukm::Report protocol buffer, before compression.

histogram.name: UKM.ResetReason
histogram.summary: Recorded when a UKM client state (client_id, session_id) is reset. This emits the reason the resetting was triggered.

histogram.name: UKM.Sources.Dropped
histogram.summary: Number of UKM sources that are dropped. Categorized by the cause of it being dropped.

histogram.name: UKM.Sources.KeptSourcesCount
histogram.summary: Number of unsent UKM sources that were kept in-memory to be potentially transmitted in the next log.

histogram.name: UKM.Sources.SerializedCount2{UkmSourceIdTypes}
histogram.summary: Number of serialized UKM sources when storing a UKM log. {UkmSourceIdTypes}

variant.name: .App
variant.summary: Restricted to app source id types.

variant.name: .Default
variant.summary: Restricted to default source id type.

variant.name: .Navigation
variant.summary: Restricted to navigation source id types.

variant.name: .Ukm
variant.summary: Restricted to UKM source id types. Deprecated and replaced by 'Default' in 2020/05.

histogram.name: UKM.Sources.UnmatchedSourcesCount
histogram.summary: Number of UKM sources that were not sent because they did not match a navigation source URL.

histogram.name: UKM.Sources.UnsentSourcesCount
histogram.summary: Number of UKM sources that were not sent because they had no associated entries.

histogram.name: UKM.UnsentLogs.DroppedSize
histogram.summary: Number of bytes in an excessively large log that was discarded while persisting UKM logs to disk to retry during next chrome run.

histogram.name: UKM.UnsentLogs.NumDropped
histogram.summary: Counter for number of UKM unsent logs removed from persistent storage.

histogram.name: UKM.WebDXFeatureSets.Dropped
histogram.summary: The reason why a web feature set was dropped. Emitted every time a call to RecordWebFeatures() results in a drop. A web feature set is a set of features that were used in a particular Source.

histogram.name: UKM.WebDXFeatureSets.SerializedCount
histogram.summary: Number of serialized UKM web feature sets when storing a UKM log. A web feature set is a set of features that were used in a particular Source.
